channel.title: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED
channel.description:
Ok, I am not a complete stranger to private servers, I had briefly hosted one about 2 years ago with Hamachi (lol) and the tutorials here were pretty much copy and paste as I didn't have a clue what I was doing. I have spent a year programming in Actionscript, and if anyone else has then you will know the similarities are so close they might as well be the same thing. Anyway, I decided to give this a go again and I just can't seem to.
I have followed the tutorial to hosting a server, I have my No-IP. But how do I get to go onto my game? Do I need to change something in the code to associate my No-Ip to the client? If I could log on then the rest would be easy. I can't remember what I did to get it running. I remember running the 'compile' file then 'runserver', and logging in to see my changes, it was all on pimpscape if that still exists lol.
Secondly, whenever I try to load http://www.moparisthebest.com/ to try and use the client to log onto my server (was going to play around as I didn't know how) the Java loading symbol comes up for a few seconds and the screen goes black. Then the pages on these forums are not accessible, if I refresh they do not load. This lasts for 10-15mins then it' back to normal. Any idea what is causing this? It was working fine before I installed Mopar on my comp (which doesn't seem to load properly either).
Sorry for being a noob, but I've been trying for 1-2 hours now and I am out of options. :(
Please help :S[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 05:08:16 pm[/size][hr]Please help, I'm sure there is a simple solution. :(

item.title: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED
item.dc:creator: @WiredScape WiredScape
item.description:
@WiredScape wrote:

127.0.0.1 will always work on the computer your hosting it on but not for others. But this ip will only work for your own computer, not others.

Really I don’t think your experianced at all. No-ip is a step int he process but you MUST portforward!

Do you know what portforwarding is?

Read full topic
item.source: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED

item.title: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED
item.dc:creator: @luis_figo109 luis figo109
item.description:
@luis_figo109 wrote:

Ok thanks for the responses. How can I test it myself though? I have another computer downstairs I can use to check (will see soon) but I want to test things on the same computer. I tried 127.0.0.1 as the IP which works, but is that the correct way to get onto my server so that if other people were there I would see them?

I am using Silab client webpage for now because the mopar client doesn’t work at all for me. I have re/installed java many times and it makes no difference. I have no trouble with Java applications like the usual RS etc, just seems to be Mopar.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 27, 2009, 08:43:23 pm[/size][hr]Ok I have managed to fix the annoying port forwarding, I just repeated what I did, changed the last number to 4 and re-added UDP again. So people can join me

The mopar client still doesn’t work though. The downloaded version will stop at the image below, then after about 10 seconds it closes. Any reason for it?

Read full topic
item.source: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED

item.title: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED
item.dc:creator: @WiredScape WiredScape
item.source: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED

item.title: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED
item.dc:creator: @life-scape life-scape
item.description:
@life-scape wrote:

  1. Go to No-IP.org
  2. Log in
  3. Click “ADD A HOST”
  4. Type in the Hostname you would like, and select the #####.com you would like.
  5. Open No-IP client
  6. Checkmark your Hostname you just created, let it update. Un-check it, then Re-check it.
  7. Run you server

Have a friend test it out from his computer and ask him to try to log in from the hostname. (ex. Myserver.no-ip.org)

Read full topic
item.source: Standard noob question I expect UNANSWERED
